content: The Act is titled the "Los Angeles Homeless Veterans Leasing Act of 2016" and authorizes certain leases at the Department of Veterans Affairs West Los Angeles Campus. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may carry out leases at the Department of Veterans Affairs West Los Angeles Campus for purposes benefiting veterans and their families, including providing supportive housing and services promoting health and wellness. Leases can be for a term not exceeding 50 years to third parties. Leases at the Department of Veterans Affairs West Los Angeles Campus can benefit veterans and their families by providing services such as health promotion, education, vocational training, peer activities, legal assistance, volunteerism, family support, transportation, and more for up to 50 years. The curr_chunk discusses the lease of real property to The Regents of the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) campus for up to 10 years, with conditions related to the provision of services to veterans. The Regents of the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) may lease real property for up to 10 years if the lease aligns with the master plan, focuses on services for veterans, and includes additional support as deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Secretary may provide additional services and support to The Regents of UCLA through a lease agreement, benefiting veterans and their families with various activities related to their needs.
